name: Suites Gran Via 44

reviews.text: We stayed at the Suites Gran Via 44 in Granada because of the many good comments by TripAdvisor contributors. We stayed for 3 nights in total. The Suites Gran Via 44 is located right along the main trunk of Granada, making it superbly convenient for tourists. The exterior of the building is unremarkable and easily missed.
reviews.title: Nice service apartments but needs better housekeeping standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is an all suites service apartment style property. We got a superior suite with one bedroom and a sofa bed included. Upon superficial look, it seems fine, reasonably modern and well furnised (though the quality of the furnishings are really basic and simple). Very "IKEA" like actually. Bathroom was tiny for the size of the apartment. The best thing about the service apartment was the bed and pillors. Very firm and comfortable!
reviews.title: Perfect hotel with great central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Be warned too that the windows are not double glazed so the noise from the main street can be quite audible at night especially for units facing the main road.
reviews.title: Good place to stay in Granada, despite the limited hot water in the winter!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Housekeeping was however, of a disappointing standard. The wooden floors were not clean, felt grimmy and "sticky". The sofa bed was quite dirty.
reviews.title: Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was disappointing too.
reviews.title: Beautiful, spacious suites. Great value for the money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This small suite hotel offers everything one would ask for in Granda.
reviews.title: excellent in every way

reviews.text: Location: A few minutees walk to the Cathedral and Placa Real; up the rising houses of Albayzen just behind the hotel, a good climb; all major iternal buses including the ones to the Sonja and Susie were all that and charming, Felippe, the manager, caring and efficient. The hotel offers breakfast at an additional charge, but we prefered our own in our suite. There is also an excellent espresso=cappucino machine available at all times for guests in their basement chill-out room.
reviews.title: What a find!
Wow...nicest hotel we stayed at in 2 weeks in Spain!
reviews.text: We spent six days in Granada, leisyrely tourig,including the white Sierra Nevada villages, with Suites Gran Via as our base.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No doubt the base and its personnel made these dayseven richer!
reviews.title: Just fantastic!

reviews.text: Stayed at the Suites Gran via 44 for 1 night October 8-9, 2010. We arrived from Sevilla in the early afternoon and we had backpacks with us; we knew our room would not be ready. Also, we would be checking out the next morning and had Alhambra tickets and didn't want to have to haul around our luggage. So I emailed ahead and asked if they would be able hold our luggage both days and they quickly replied that yes, it would be no problem! The hotel is centrally located on Gran Via de Colon, which is a major thoroughfare through Granada. We were SO pleased when we arrived, pleasantly greeted and they locked our bags into a room right off the lobby so we could explore Granada until our room was ready. We returned a couple hours later and were told our rooms were ready. We rounded the corner and saw the beautiful sitting area! We took the all glass elevator up to the 3rd floor and we were in the end suite. Much to my surprise, it was a HUGE apartment (I missed that they were apartments somehow!) done up in wonderful colors and textures! We had a bedroom view of the courtyard and a city view off the patio. The kitchen/living area was in warm colors and stainless appliances...plus a sofa bed. The bathroom was stocked for TWO people (toiletries) and the blow dryer was not the standard hotel issue, but a full size (which is important when you both have a full head of curly hair!), which made us thrilled since we didnt carry one with us! The bedroom was in soft muted tones, with great lighting and MEMORY FOAM mattresses and pillows!! We had the BEST night sleep the entire trip here (we even overslept on accident)!! 2 flatscreen TV's--in living area and bedroom. We walked again around the city and had a light fare at the Restaurante Asador El Aguador - Pizzería which was simply delicious. The next morning we checked out and again, they held our bags for us in the locked room. We toured the Alhambra all day (DO NOT MISS IT) and as we left, it began to rain. we decided to grab another bite to eat before we headed back to the bus station and since we enjoyed our meal the day before so much, we returned to Restaurante Asador El Aguador - Pizzería (right by the Cathedral) for another meal. Since it had outdoor seating, we wern't sure where we'd sit, but they not only enclosed the area with a tent, they moved in patio heaters so we could enjoy our meal without freezing (temps dropped quickly in the rain) We returned to the Suites Gran via 44 to retrieve our bags and we were welcomed to dry off and get situated before we had to catch a taxi. I will tell you that taxis are scarce in the rain in Granada. They hotel offered to call one, but another guest waited an hour, so we took our chances. It took about 30 minutes and every taxi passed us by and we were standing by a taxi stand! We finally found a taxi who reluctantly took us to the bus station.
reviews.title: Lovely suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights in June/July 2011.
reviews.title: One of favorite accomodations ever!

reviews.text: Location: Fantastic. 5-10 minute walk to shopping/restaurants. 15 minute walk to the start of the Albacyin. 20 minute walk to mirador (viewpoint). 30 minute walk to Alhambra. From the bus station take #3 or #33 to get here and get off at the first stop after the roundabout with the Spanish flag.
reviews.title: Great location and a great option if you would like to have a kitchen, living room, and dining room

reviews.text: Room: the kitchen, living room, bedroom, and bathroom were very spacious and clean, modern and attractive. The bed was comfortable, and I loved the Japanese toilet! The shower was great with the two attachments. Safe in the room, closet to hang cloths, 2 flat screen TVs (one in bedroom), lots of room to store luggage, free WIFI, great shower.
reviews.title: Great Spot for Families in Granada

reviews.text: Overall: we loved this place, one of my favorites out of all my travels, great value as well considering it’s a suite.
reviews.title: Close to everything. Hard to find

reviews.text: Recommendations: We did a lovely olive oil tour (http://www.oliveoiltour.com/). For tapas we quite liked Om Khalsum (Calle Jardine 17) and Poe (Calle Veronica del Magdalena 40). There's an excellent gelato place right by the hotel that we went to every night - Los Italianos (Gran Vía de Colón 4).
reviews.title: Spacious, clean rooms in a nice property with a good location but noisy

reviews.text: Very nice suite for two adults and two kids.We were upgraded to a two bedrooms suite at check in.Everything great,ROOM,FRONT DESK STAFF,TRANSPORT TO AIRPORT...
reviews.title: very nice suite

reviews.text: Granada is a very nice city and Suites Gran Via is very well located and also very beautifull.
reviews.title: Modern apartments, helpful staff, well located

reviews.text: Stayed 3 nights in June, which was the right amount of time in Granada for us seeming we were taking things slow with a 1 year old.
reviews.title: Great place - huge apartments in ideal location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk staff gave us our apartment before check-in time and were very helpful always, if you remember someone's name (Suzi) you know they were good! Baby cot arranged as requested. The airport bus stops about 3 minutes walk away (slightly closer if you stop before the hotel rather than after, but not a drama if you don't!).
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The apartment was very modern and we did not find anything lacking, everything was thought of! Actually much more luxurious than we were expecting and quiet. The hotel is just a 5 minute stroll depending on your pace from the centre of town and the bus is just across and 50 metres up the road to the Alhambra.
reviews.title: Outstanding find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we stayed in suite 22 at the back of the building.it was dark and so depressing that i hated any time spent in the suite.i preferred to sit on the fire escape and read than stay in the room.breakfast was served in the room.the breakfast was good but always the same and not enough coffee.i did ask for a kettle and a corkscrew which was promptly delivered.
reviews.title: overall it was disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the bed was small and very soft.the bedroom was tiny and so was the shower room.the electric bidet was a plus feature.the shampoo/shower gel bottles had all been refilled and the packaging looked tatty and were not replenished.
reviews.title: Top Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: the suite was quiet and i had no trouble with noise.the staff were ok and pleasant.the location was ok.
reviews.title: best in granada

reviews.text: the lounge/kitcen area had a very uncomfortable sofa and the lighting was poor.not good enough to read.
reviews.title: Great location, SUPERB HOTEL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: overall i could not advise people to stay in this hotel
reviews.title: Great value for a super apartment in walking distance of everything

reviews.text: What a great location centre of town and next to the old town, very welcoming, rooms were perfect, very clean all the staff were fantastic.
reviews.title: Perfect location, Perfect staff, Perfect rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a great 4 days, rooms very well sound proofed never heard anything from other rooms a little outside noise as we were facing the road but not too bad. My wife found the bed a little hard but it was perfect for me.
reviews.title: Like having an apartment in the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were very attentive, would not stay anywhere else in Granada.
reviews.title: Spacious, gracious, perfectly appointed and VALUE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms had everything you could need
reviews.title: Great location, very spacious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We traveled for two weeks in southern Spain. I have to say of all the hotels I've stayed in in the US and Spain the room here was by far the largest. It was basically a small apartment. Everything was very clean and modern. The bed was super comfortable bthe staff spoke English and went out of their way to help us book tickets to the Alhambra. Location is excellent. We will definitely be staying here again if we are ever in Granada.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great value and fantastic service

reviews.text: What a beautiful little boutique hotel this proved to be. I stayed here in July 2010 with my mother and 2 children, ages 9 and 7. From the start, the staff was very friendly and helpful. After a bit of difficulty parking our rental during the check in period, we were greeted with a cool, welcoming, hip-looking atrium. The warm gurgling sounds of the atrium fountain added to the feeling that you were in a peaceful oasis. The decor of the public areas and the rooms is colorful and cheery. Think teals, oranges, yellows. That said, nothing clashes and just taking in the space makes you smile and say "Ahhhh."
reviews.title: A Sparkling Gem!

reviews.text: We were led to two gorgeous rooms. Each was very different, but both were large with separate bedrooms. Beds and pillows were super comfortable. The bathrooms were sparklingly clean and modern. The kitchen areas were well-stocked in both rooms and it was nice to have the complimentary breakfast on the good-sized dining tables. I just wish our 2-day stay had been extended.
reviews.title: An excellent place to stay

reviews.text: Granada itself was lovely. It made you feel like you were in a hidden corner of the world.
reviews.title: Spacious suite but noisy

reviews.text: If you have a rental car, the hotel does have garage accomodation. The garage is a scenic 5-minute walk away.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a wonderful, warm, welcoming home away from home.
reviews.title: Incredible location. Helpful staff

reviews.text: Suites are spacious, clean and very helpful staff. But noise from the main road can get annoying and going past many hotels whilst sightseeing around albaysin and sacrament would have left a more lovelier memories.
reviews.title: Nice but Keep on looking

reviews.text: Gran Via 44 is not by the Alhambra but it is closer to restaurants and other necessities. We had our 2 Grandchildren with us so we got a two bedroom suite. The only minus was that we only had one bathroom for 4 people. The hotel is very comfortable and well located for transportation and dining.
reviews.title: Francisco was so welcoming it made our stay even better!

reviews.text: Francisco at the front desk is a real plus for the hotel. He was anxious to please and extremely friendly. You won't go wrong to stay at this hotel if you are more than two people. It really is suited for families.
reviews.title: Perfect for a short family stay in Granada

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As usual was struggling to find accomodation for family of 5 so ended up booking two suites via Lastminute.com. The suites were very clean, well appointed with extremely comfortable beds, and powerful aircon. There appeared to be sufficient equipment for self catering but with so many restaurants in the area!! If you do need to self cater then the best place to shop is in the market close to the Cathdral which is just down the road. The same for breakfast.
reviews.title: Loved the staff and location!

reviews.text: I'd say the location was perfect for exploration on foot however Gran Via is a busy street and it can be noisy, especially in the morning before the 7am traffic restrictions. Car access is extremely difficult and not to be tackled unless you understand the restrictions and have nerves of steel to drive down the very narrow unrestricted streets behind the hotel. Granada is not a place where cars are encouraged! We left the car in an underground car park 1/2 mile away (20 euros a day) and taxied to and from the hotel.
reviews.title: Very noisy and poorly furnished

description: Suites Gran Vía 44, a luxury hotel in Granada. A Nineteenth Century building which has been carefully restored, located in Granada’s Gran Vía - a result of the expansion of the moneyed classes in that period and the principal artery of the city. Discover a new concept in accommodation, combining the service of a hotel and the independence of your own apartment, in Granada city centre.
